title: F.J. Martinez-Murcia
text: Telecommunications Engineer and PhD in Information and Communication Technologies from the University of Granada. Currently, Ramon y Cajal researcher at the University of Granada, specialising in signal processing and analysis and medical brain imaging. Finalist in Famelab 2018 and winner of 3-Minute Thesis Granada 2017. Musician and hopeless geek.

title: F.J. Martinez-Murcia
text:
Education

Telecommunications Engineer (2010) | University of Granada
MsC in Computer and Network Engineering (2011) | University of Granada
PhD in Information and Communications Technology (2017) | University of Granada

title: F.J. Martinez-Murcia
text:
Experience

Website manager, front-end development (2010-2011) | Language4you education S.L.
Predoctoral researcher (2014-2017) | University of Granada, Granada
Postdoctoral researcher (2018-2019) | DaSCI – Andalusian Institute on Data Science and Computational Intelligence, Granada
Juan de la Cierva – formación fellow (2019-2020) | University of Malaga, Granada
Jose Castillejo fellow (2019) | Ludwig-Maximilien Universität München / Deutsche Zentrum für Neurodegenerative Erkrankungen
Juan de la Cierva – incorporación fellow (2020-2022) | University of Granada, Granada
Ramon y Cajal fellow (2023 - ) | University of Granada, Granada
CAS Research Group Fellow (2023 - ) | Ludwig-Maximilien Universität München
